---
labels: ['kubernetes', 'deployment', 'adapter', 'gke']
description: 'Adapter to deploy a Bit platform to a Google Kubernetes Engine cluster.'
---

This is a [Google Kubernetes Engine](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine) adapter for the [Kubernetes Deployer](https://bit/cloudbackend/kubernetes/kubernetes-deployer). To use it, set your Kubernetes deployer like so:

```ts
/** @filename: my-platform.bit-app.ts */

import { Platform } from '@bitdev/platforms.platform';
import { KubernetesDeployer } from '@backend/kubernetes.kubernetes-deployer';
// import the K8S Google Cloud Adapater
import { GKEAdapter } from '@backend/kubernetes.adapters.gke';

export const AcmePlatform = Platform.from({
  // ...
  deploy: KubernetesDeployer.deploy({
    /* use glob pattern to include the YAML files for the K8S apply */
    files: ['./kubernetes/*.yaml'],
    adapter: new GKEAdapter({
      clusterName: 'acme-platform',
      zone: 'us-central1',
      /**
       * create a service account with the proper permissions to genrate
       *  a K8S cluster. The env var should hold the JSON key content
       *  or the absolute path to the JSON file
       */
      keyJson: process.env.K8S_GOOGLE_CLOUD,
    }),
  }),
});

export default AcmePlatform;
```

> When building and deploying using Ripple CI, make sure to set the `keyJson` value as [a secret](https://bit.dev/reference/ci/ripple-ci#ripple-ci-secrets)

See the [Kubernetes Deployer documentation](Kubernetes Deployer](https://bit.cloud/backend/kubernetes/kubernetes-deployer) to learn how to deploy your platform.
